p: We obtained Ebola virus (EBOV) genomes from the US National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID) Virus Pathogen Database and Analysis Resource (ViPR) through the web site at http://www.viprbrc.org/ [ 42] in October 2017. We removed short sequences, sequences from tissue-cultured EBOV isolates, duplicate sequences from the same clinical EVD case, and sequences with >0.2% ambiguous or missing nucleotide calls. The final dataset consisted of 1823 EBOV complete or near-complete genomes.
